subject: RE: [junit] Separate Assertion Object
msgSnippet: ... Bad choice for an example.  Let me rephrase the question: When adding custom Assert methods of your own, would you need to add any new method signatures to
messageBody:
>
> Why have custom methods? Why not simply implement equals()
> appropriately? Is this old ground? :)
>

Bad choice for an example. Let me rephrase the question:

When adding custom Assert methods of your own, would you need to add any
new method signatures to the Assert class? Or would extending the
current class interface be sufficient?

Manuel Amago.
